skill.name: create-skill-file
skill.description: Guides Claude in creating well-structured SKILL.md files following best practices. Provides clear guidelines for naming, structure, and content organization to make skills easy to discover and execute.

skill.author: YYH211

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown files. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or command execution. The skill provides templates and guidelines for creating SKILL.md files.

content.value_statement: Creating SKILL.md files manually leads to inconsistent structure and poor discoverability. This skill provides templates, guidelines, and examples for building well-organized skill documentation that activates correctly and helps users achieve their goals.
actual_capabilities: Generate basic and workflow SKILL.md templates
Provide naming conventions and description guidelines
Show good and bad skill examples with explanations
Define trigger conditions and activation keywords
Include error handling and troubleshooting sections
limitations: Does not execute any commands or modify files directly
Only provides guidance for documentation, not skill functionality
Templates require user adaptation for specific use cases
Examples are illustrative and not executable code

use_cases.title: Standardize skill documentation
use_cases.description: Create consistent, well-structured SKILL.md files across your organization's skill library

use_cases.title: Build multi-step workflows
use_cases.description: Design complex automation skills with decision points, error handling, and validation steps

use_cases.title: Improve skill discoverability
use_cases.description: Write effective descriptions and trigger keywords that activate skills at the right moment

prompt_templates.title: Basic skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a SKILL.md file for a skill that [describe what the skill does]. Include frontmatter with name and description, a When to Use section, How It Works steps, and an Examples section.

prompt_templates.title: Workflow skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a workflow SKILL.md template for [describe the workflow]. Include preparation phase, detailed steps with decision points, error handling procedures, and rollback instructions.

prompt_templates.title: Improve existing
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this SKILL.md file and identify issues with naming, structure, triggers, and examples. Provide an improved version following best practices from the templates.

prompt_templates.title: Best practices
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the key principles for writing effective SKILL.md files. Include guidance on naming conventions, description structure, freedom levels, and when to split content into multiple files.

output_examples.input: Create a skill that helps with database migrations using Alembic
output: Generated SKILL.md with frontmatter including name and description
When to Use section with activation keywords like 'Alembic' and 'database migration'
How It Works steps covering create, apply, and rollback operations
Examples showing migration commands and expected output
Best Practices section with Do and Don't items

best_practices: Use specific, descriptive names with action verbs and include relevant keywords in descriptions
Follow progressive disclosure: keep SKILL.md under 500 lines and move details to separate files
Test skill activation by using trigger phrases and adjust descriptions based on results
anti_patterns: Using generic names like 'helper' or 'utility' that do not describe specific functionality
Including basic programming knowledge that Claude already knows
Writing overly detailed steps that leave no room for Claude to adapt to context

faq.question: Which AI tools support SKILL.md files?
faq.answer: Claude, Codex, and Claude Code all support skills with SKILL.md files. The skill works across all three platforms.

faq.question: What is the ideal length for a SKILL.md file?
faq.answer: Aim for 200-500 lines. Split into multiple files using templates and references if content exceeds 500 lines.

faq.question: How do I make my skill activate correctly?
faq.answer: Use specific keywords in the description that users actually say. Test activation by trying natural language requests and refine triggers.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only generates text templates. It does not read, write, or transmit any files or data.

faq.question: Why are my skills not being triggered?
faq.answer: Check that keywords in your description match user language. Avoid generic terms and be specific about use cases and scenarios.

faq.question: How does this compare to writing skills without templates?
faq.answer: Templates provide consistent structure and proven patterns. They reduce errors and improve discoverability compared to ad-hoc skill writing.
